post_text:
We officially have the first week of the 2020-21 school year under our belts! We are so proud of our students, parents, and staff for tackling this year with patience, grace, and flexibility. We are in this together and look forward to a great school year.

Just a reminder that there will be NO SCHOOL tomorrow, Friday, September 4th and Monday, September 7th in observance of Labor Day. We will start back with our virtual learning on Tuesday, September 8th. Please have a great long weekend!

It has come to our attention that the PowerSchool app is no longer supported and should not be used. Instead, students and families may access their PowerSchool Portal by using the Internet browser on their device and visiting https://pssouthhaven.berrienresa.org/public/. The web address can also be found at www.shps.org under ‘Parent Resources’ on the ‘Resources’ tab.

We thank you for your flexibility and patience and ask that you reach out to us with any questions or concerns.

post_text: K-3 Families: If your child is experiencing issues with multimedia content in SeeSaw, first make sure you are connected to the Internet and then manually delete the app by pressing and holding the corner of the app until an X appears. Then press the X. The next time your iPad checks in with eSpark's management system, the app will reinstall. If, for some reason, it doesn't reinstall or if this doesn't fix your problem, please email lsmith@shps.org. Include your child's name and the yellow barcode number located on the back of the iPad. Thank you for your patience and flexibility!
text: K-3 Families: If your child is experiencing issues with multimedia content in SeeSaw, first make sure you are connected to the Internet and then manually delete the app by pressing and holding the corner of the app until an X appears. Then press the X. The next time your iPad checks in with eSpark's management system, the app will reinstall. If, for some reason, it doesn't reinstall or if this doesn't fix your problem, please email lsmith@shps.org. Include your child's name and the yellow barcode number located on the back of the iPad. Thank you for your patience and flexibility!

post_text: We were thrilled to welcome staff back to our buildings this week! Here's a few shots in action as we prepared for the start of school on Monday, August 31st!

post_text:
STARTING TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 1ST: Our South Haven Food & Nutrition Services Team looks forward to serving your SHPS student with 5 free breakfasts and lunches each week! As we begin this year with virtual instruction, food deliveries will take place at predetermined mobile sites on Tuesdays with curbside pick up available at South Haven High School from 3:30 - 6:00 PM. Check out our website for a full list of stop time and locations at http://www.shps.org/news/food_distribution_offerings_2020-21_school_year

*Please note that due to USDA and federal guidelines, the food distribution program during the school year is intended for SHPS enrolled students only. Families will be asked to provide student names when they receive a meal kit at any of our locations.

Please contact the Administration Building with questions at (269) 637-0500.

post_text:
Don’t miss out on a great opportunity to receive a FREE dairy box tomorrow, August 11th! 480 boxes will be distributed on a first come, first serve basis at South Haven High School from 3:30 - 5:30 PM in the south parking lot on Tuesday. Boxes include 2 gallons of milk and other assorted dairy products. There are no eligibility requirements and one box will be given per family as supplies last.

Also available tomorrow are our regular food offerings including curbside pick up at North Shore Elementary and distribution at our mobile food sites.

Don’t forget, if you have items you would like to return from the 2019-20 school year, there will be a bin for drop off at each of our sites.

Please note: this is the last week for meal service from South Haven Public Schools for the summer. Visit http://www.shps.org/news/summer_meal_offerings_2020 for stop locations, times, and additional details! We hope to see you there!

post_text:
A reminder as you contemplate your selection between in person and virtual learning for the fall of 2020 that if you have not already committed one way or the other, our staff will begin calling this Thursday, August 6th to speak with you. We will ask two questions:

Do you plan to participate in in-person instruction?
Do you plan to use our busing system?

To assist you in your decision, we have prepared sample schedules and additional resources for our entirely virtual option, Ram Connection for your review. This information has been emailed to the parent/guardian address on file and is available on our website at: http://www.shps.org/resources/returning_to_learning_20-21/ram_connection_-_virtual_school

post_text:
It's GRADUATION SUNDAY for the Class of 2020! Congratulations to this very deserving class. We are so proud of you and can't wait to celebrate you today!

The ceremony begins at 12:00 PM and will be live-streamed on the district's Facebook (here!) and YouTube (South Haven Public Schools YouTube) accounts! Tune in to FM radio station 89.1 to listen to the ceremony. We want to see your photos from the day! Upload them and tag South Haven Public Schools to participate in the festivities, bonus if you use the district's special graduation Snapchat filter, available at the ceremony until 4:00 PM today!

For more information on the graduation ceremony and how it will be facilitated this year, visit our website at http://www.shps.org/news/graduation_update_2020

post_text:
There's another opportunity for quick and convenient COVID-19 testing tomorrow, Friday, July 17th at South Haven High School in the south parking lot from 2:00 - 6:00 PM! InterCare Community Health Network is providing drive-thru testing.

Currently, the State of Michigan has set the following testing requirements:
- You feel sick
- Someone close to you feels sick
- You work outside the home, even if you don't have symptoms
- You are part of a vulnerable population (aged, minority, immunocompromised)
- You are entering or are already living in a congregate setting like a nursing home or a foster home
- You are going to the hospital for a surgical procedure, even if you don't have symptoms.

Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/309129283459159/
text:
There's another opportunity for quick and convenient COVID-19 testing tomorrow, Friday, July 17th at South Haven High School in the south parking lot from 2:00 - 6:00 PM! InterCare Community Health Network is providing drive-thru testing.

Currently, the State of Michigan has set the following testing requirements:
- You feel sick
- Someone close to you feels sick
- You work outside the home, even if you don't have symptoms
- You are part of a vulnerable population (aged, minority, immunocompromised)
- You are entering or are already living in a congregate setting like a nursing home or a foster home
- You are going to the hospital for a surgical procedure, even if you don't have symptoms.

Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/309129283459159/

Quick, convenient, and easy COVID-19 testing is coming to the South Haven High School courtesy of Intercare's Mobile Testing Site!

On Friday, July 10th and Friday, July 17th, Intercare's mobile testing site will be set up in the south parking lot at South Haven High School and testing will be open to the public! No one will be turned away based on inability to pay. The test is covered by most insurances.

Currently, the State of Michigan has set the following testing requirements:
- You feel sick
- Someone close to you feels sick
- You work outside the home, even if you don't have symptoms
- You are part of a vulnerable population
- You are entering or are already living in a congregate setting like a nursing home or a foster home
- You are going to the hospital for a surgical procedure, even if you don't have symptoms

post_text: Thank you to the Rotary Club of South Haven, Michigan and South Haven Public Schools Foundation for continuing to support South Haven Public Schools and our educators! Each year, the Rotary Club makes a $250 contribution to the South Haven Public Schools Foundation in honor of its Educator of the Year who this year, is Anna DeVries, a third grade teacher at Lincoln Elementary. The contribution was presented this weekend to Foundation Treasurer, Barry Skuza. Making the presentation were President-Elect Dan Thompson and Treasurer Bob Straits. They were joined by Dan's granddaughter, Elizabeth. #RamPride

post_text:
While awaiting the virtual NHD competition results, National Finalist, Nic Sheppard, assisted with a WMU College History research project.

Kasagake or Kasakake (笠懸, lit. "hat shooting") is a type of Japanese mounted archery. In contrast to yabusame, the types of targets are various and the archer shoots without stopping the horse. While yabusame has been played as a part of formal ceremonies, kasagake has developed as a game or practice of martial arts, focusing on technical elements of horse archery.
text:

Kasagake or Kasakake (笠懸, lit. "hat shooting") is a type of Japanese mounted archery. In contrast to yabusame, the types of targets are various and the archer shoots without stopping the horse. While yabusame has been played as a part of formal ceremonies, kasagake has developed as a game or practice of martial arts, focusing on technical elements of horse archery.

We are so grateful for your kindness and support!
text: A huge shoutout to Shannon Kellogg, daughter of our late food service manager Karen Goss, and her coworkers at the Van Buren Community Mental Health Department for providing our food service staff with a pick-me-up "thank you" bag filled with goodies in the heart of our food distribution operation this spring! We are so grateful for your kindness and support!

post_text: Congratulations, to our very own Mrs. Sheppard! We are so proud to have you representing our school and the entire state! The award recipient will be announced at the National History Day Award Ceremony this Saturday, June 20th! #RamPride
shared_text:
Michigan History Day
June 15 at 2:05 PM ·

We are proud to have Julie Sheppard as the MI nominee for the 2020 Hannah E. (Liz) MacGregor Teacher of the Year Award.

Each of the 58 National History Day affiliates may nominate one high school teacher for this award, and Mrs. Sheppard is the senior division nominee from Michigan. Every nominee for the $10,000 award is a teacher who demonstrates a commitment to engaging students in historical learning through innovative use of primary sources, implementation of active learning strategies to foster historical thinking skills, and participation in the National History Day Contest.

The winner of the award will be announced during the NHD Award Ceremony on Saturday, June 20. Good luck Julie!

post_text: As we eagerly await the results of this weekend's virtual NHD competition, help us congratulate Myles, Nic, and Tabi, our History Club National Finalists, for being featured by Michigan History Day today! Nic and Myles are competing with their Group Exhibit on "The Wright Brothers" and Tabi is competing with an Individual Documentary on "Motown."
shared_text:
Michigan History Day is with Dale Sheppard.
June 15 at 11:52 AM ·

Today we are introducing students from South Haven High School and Orchard View High School. Tabi made the trip to NHD when she was an alternate a few years ago to learn from the experience and this year she is a National Finalist! Nic and Myles are a winning team, representing Michigan again at the National Finals.

Nathan wrote a fantastic senior paper and we wish him the best of luck!

#mihistoryday2020 #NHD2020

post_text:
Welcome to the final week of our Learning at a Distance Plan for the 2019-20 school year! We are so proud of our students, school community, and staff for pushing through this unique year.

This week's instructional material can be found on our website at http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020 and has been emailed to students and parents. It will also be shared with students on Google Drive. Families without Internet connectivity will receive paper packets delivered to their homes today.

Students working on iPads should check their 'Shared with me' folder in Google Slides and click 'present' to access all links and videos. Please don't hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns!

It will also be shared with students on Google Drive. Families without Internet connectivity will receive paper packets delivered to their homes today.

Students working on iPads should check their 'Shared with me' folder in Google Slides and click 'present' to access all links and videos. Please don't hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns!

Our first day of curbside item pick up for students in kindergarten through 8th grade is TOMORROW (6/3/20)! Stop by your child's school between 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM and pick up your child items such as medication and lost and found items, while returning library books, school-issued instruments, uniforms etc. Can't make it tomorrow? There is a second opportunity on Thursday, June 4th from 4:00 - 6:00 PM!

*Reminder, students should keep their school-issued devices over the summer for OPTIONAL enrichment activities. More details on this will come shortly. Please DO NOT return iPads and Chromebooks at curbside pick up.

post_text:
Congratulations to the recipients of the NEW South Haven Rotary Scholarship - Sierra Garber, Opal Eddy, Victoria Loikits, and Katherine Schooley! This scholarship looked beyond academic achievement and considered ways in which the students have applied Rotary's “Four Way Test" to their lives.

The new scholarships are in addition to another fund supported by the South Haven Rotarians. Since 2004, the club has donated nearly $200,000 to the Rotary Scholarship Fund held at Lake Michigan College and to the South Haven Schools Fund managed through the Greater South Haven Area Community Foundation. More information on this can be found on the Rotary website: https://www.southhavenrotary.org/?fbclid=IwAR362SdHPV-Vrpf41eOZQZTSsWy2B4Butd5qyZfZz-f2LUuAtwFmtvcOAA4

Thank you to the Rotary for always supporting SHPS and our students! #RamPride #ThankfulTuesday

Welcome to Week 6 of our Continuity of Learning Plan and the last full week of the 2019-20 school year! For you convenience, there are a few different ways to access your child's materials. Visit our website at http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020 for this week's links by grade level. Students and parents will receive an email with the same information and the files will be shared with students on Google Drive.

Students working on iPads should check in their 'Shared with me' folder in Google Slides and click 'present' to access all links and videos.

If you are experiencing Internet connectivity issues and have not contacted the district, please reach out to the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500.

Please let us know if you have any questions, concerns, or if you have trouble accessing your instructional material!

post_text:
On what would have been Graduation Sunday for our seniors, let's celebrate the South Haven High School Class of 2020! Upload a photo of your senior whether taken today, in their cap and gown, with their graduation t-shirt/yard sign, or just doing something they love. Help us flood our timelines with these great kids! Tag South Haven Public Schools or use our hashtags: #SHHSClassof2020 #RamPride

*The class of 2020 Graduation Ceremony has unfortunately moved to Scenario 3: A determination date of June 22nd as to whether or not a July 19, 2020 graduation date will be possible. We are looking into alternative possibilities to try to host the ceremony on July 19 without further delay. We must wait for guidance from the state in regards to the number of people to gather and/or identify a solution based on the current restrictions. We will continue to keep you informed.

A. Begin at South Haven High School to Elkenburg

C. St. Joseph Street to Erie (by South Beach)
D. Erie to Phoenix
E. Phoenix to Hubbard
F. Hubbard to Superior
G. Superior to Ayleworth
H. Ayleworth to LaGrange

The Parade will still begin at 8:00 PM. Thank you for your flexibility!

post_text:
South Haven Public Schools is pleased to announce that our district was selected as a recipient of fresh produce boxes through the USDA Farmers to Families Food Box Program!

Beginning with tomorrow's food delivery (5/29), one fresh produce box per family will be available for pick up along with our regular breakfasts and lunches at each of our food delivery stops while supplies last. Additionally, an especially RAMTASTIC special guest will be joining us from 3:00 - 6:00 PM tomorrow at South Haven High School to assist with curbside pick up and to promote this new program! Be sure to stop by and say hello from your car to everyone's favorite mascot, Rammie!

For more details, including stop addresses, please visit our website at http://www.shps.org/news/fresh_produce_boxes

post_text:
Give your Little Ram the best start at South Haven Public Schools for the 2020-21 school year! Online enrollment for students entering GSRP Preschool, Junior Kindergarten, or Kindergarten is NOW OPEN! Visit our website at http://www.shps.org/enrollment/virtual_kindergarten_roundup for the enrollment link.

Don't forget to upload a photo of your upcoming SHPS Ram that we can share on social media with the hashtag #SHPSVirtualRoundup2020 or email it to communications@shps.org. We want to celebrate this milestone for your kiddo and are so excited to have them with us next year!

Reminder - check back on June 1st for a special message from your child's principal right here on the SHPS District Facebook Page!

post_text:
Now entering Week 5 of our Continuity of Learning Plan! For you convenience, there are a few different ways to access your child's materials. Visit our website at http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020 for this week's links by grade level. Students and parents will receive an email with the same information and the files will be shared with students on Google Drive.

Students working on iPads should check in their 'Shared with me' folder in Google Slides and click 'present' to access all links and videos.

If you are experiencing Internet connectivity issues and have not contacted the district, please reach out to the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500.

Please let us know if you have any questions, concerns, or if you have trouble accessing your instructional material.

"A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself." - Joseph Campbell.

This Memorial Day, we want to take time to remember, thank, and honor the true heroes of our country for their sacrifice.

Due to Memorial Day, learning materials for this week will be delivered on Tuesday, May 26th. Please look to your email address on file, our website at http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020, or your child's Google Drive to access your student's information.

post_text:
We are excited to announce that SHPS will be hosting our first Virtual Kindergarten/Preschool Round up! Although it looks a little different this year, we couldn't be happier to welcome our next group of future SHPS Rams! Online registration for Kindergarten, Junior Kindergarten, and GSRP Preschool for the 2020-21 school year will open on TUESDAY, MAY 26TH!

Beginning May 26th, families looking to enroll should visit our website for links to register at: http://www.shps.org/enrollment/virtual_kindergarten_roundup. Following submission, we will contact you with follow up questions specific to your families' needs such as transportation, school placement, scheduling screening, etc.

Links for registration will remain open following the May 26th date for your convenience.

Join us on our Facebook Page on Monday, June 1st for a special message from your child's principal!

Please visit our website for more information and contact the Administration Building if you do not have access to Internet and need help enrolling at (269) 637-0500.

post_text:
Great news! The deadline for the "Color the Town" contest sponsored by the South Haven Visitors Bureau and the South Haven Center for the Arts has been extended to June 15th! The coloring sheets were included in last week's food delivery and can also be downloaded here: https://www.southhaven.org/uploads/ckeditor/files/South%20Haven%20Coloring%20Sheets(2).pdf?fbclid=IwAR1AhgWNsCRU5chxrtPfpuCfQtj1o4EMB9WSgeBvXZ035xOnVGJuUjauKRA

Students may return their completed pages when they pick up their meal bags at our food distribution stops this Friday or at South Haven High School on Fridays. There will be a box for families to place envelopes of completed pages in. The last pick up will be Friday, June 12th!

Remember, winners will receive a $25 gift card to Rocket Arcade and creations will be displayed at the South Haven Center for the Arts in the coming months in full gallery exhibition style! Sharpen your crayons and we can't wait to see our town through your eyes!

post_text: If you haven't participated already, this is a great opportunity to celebrate the hard work of our seniors! Submit your senior's photo to wcsy.com. All submissions are entered to win cash prizes courtesy of the South Haven & Bangor Banking Centers, a Division of Sturgis Bank & Trust Company and photos are hosted gallery style at https://www.wcsy.com/senior-spotlight/
shared_text:
SuperHits 103.7 COSY-FM
May 1 at 11:55 AM ·

Senior year is an important time for high school students — it’s a time to celebrate the hard work of the past 12 school years as well as say goodbye to teachers, classmates and friends as they embark on their new journeys into college or their selected career paths.

The class of 2020 may not get to experience those moments — but we would like to highlight them!

Submit your high school senior's photo at wcsy.com and tell us their story. All submissions are entered to win CASH PRIZES, including:

$250 Grand Prize
$100 Second Prize
$100 Third Prize
$50 Fourth Prize

Courtesy of the South Haven & Bangor Banking Centers, a Division of Sturgis Bank & Trust Company

post_text:
Welcome to Week 4 of the Continuity of Learning Plan! For your convenience, there are a few different ways to access your child's materials. Visit our website at http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020 for this week's links by grade level. Students and parents will receive an email with the same information and the files will be shared with students on Google Drive.

Students working on iPads should check in their 'Shared with me' folder in Google Slides and click 'present' to access all links and videos.

If you are experiencing Internet connectivity issues and have not contacted the district, please reach out to the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500.

We are in this together! Please let us know if you have any questions, concerns, or if you have trouble accessing your instructional material.

post_text:
Hey, Rams Families! Reminder - Your child's learning at a distance materials will be available tomorrow morning. The materials can be accessed in a number of ways for your convenience:

1) Via parent email on file
2) Through our website at http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020
3) Via student email
4) Through students' Google Drive

Learning packets will also be delivered to the homes of families with Internet connectivity issues.

Check back tomorrow to kick off another great week of learning! #InThisTogether #StayConnected #DoingMIPart

post_text:
Help us spread the word! It's Food Distribution Friday and there are some great surprises included on top of our delicious breakfasts and lunches for our kiddos in this week's bags! Don't miss out on school supplies from the district and a fun activity for your child during the Stay Home, Stay Safe Order courtesy of the South Haven Visitors Bureau. Check out the insert regarding the Color the Town project to learn about your chance to win at $20 gift card to Rocket Arcade!

A full list of our stops/curbside pick up including addresses and times can be found on our website at http://www.shps.org/news/food_deliveries_on_fridays

post_text:
Congratulations to our students that competed at State this weekend and the entire History Club on their outstanding work this season! We are ecstatic to announce that the team will be competing at the NATIONAL level for the 11th time this year based on qualifications at State! We are so proud of not only their work, but also of the young adults that they are! We can't wait to see what nationals holds for the team and History Club Coach, Mrs. Sheppard, who is this year's Michigan nominee for the prestigious Hannah E. (Liz) MacGregor Award!

Tabi Newberry - national finalist and Best Entry on Michigan History Award for her documentary film on Motown.
Nic Sheppard & Myles Daugherty - national finalists for their exhibit board on the Wright Brothers.
Kendra Burrows - national alternate with her performance on Margaret Sanger.
Jessee Ford and Avery Daugherty - national alternates for their documentary film on Nicole Malachowski.

Way to go, Rams! #RamPride
shared_text:
South Haven History Club

Congratulations to our RAMS today! This was a hard competition and limiting when we can't do interviews. We are proud of all of you!!

Tabitha Newberry. National finalist in senior individual Documentary.

Nic Sheppard and Myles Daugherty National finalists for senior Group Exhibit.

Jessee Ford and Avery Daugherty National Altrrnates senior Group Documentary.

Kendra Burrows. National alternate senior individual performance.

post_text: Wow, what a great addition to South Haven High School! We are beyond grateful to South Haven Project CURB and everyone who contributed to make this berm a reality! Your generosity and support is so appreciated and we couldn't ask for a better community! #RamPride
shared_text:
South Haven Project CURB is at South Haven High School.
May 6 at 3:00 PM · South Haven, MI ·

What a difference a day can make. 1,000 cubic yards of dirt, 12 deciduous trees, 5 evergreens and 3 types of shrubs make up this 300 foot berm. #gamechanger #shprojectcurb @ South Haven High School
text:
Wow, what a great addition to South Haven High School! We are beyond grateful to South Haven Project CURB and everyone who contributed to make this berm a reality! Your generosity and support is so appreciated and we couldn't ask for a better community! #RamPride

South Haven Project CURB is at South Haven High School.
May 6 at 3:00 PM · South Haven, MI ·

What a difference a day can make. 1,000 cubic yards of dirt, 12 deciduous trees, 5 evergreens and 3 types of shrubs make up this 300 foot berm. #gamechanger #shprojectcurb @ South Haven High School

post_text:
Even though we can't physically be together to celebrate Staff Appreciation Week as we normally would this year, we would still like to take some time to recognize the wonderful people at the heart of our district! Whether it has been reworking how we service our kids academically, providing meals to families, or even taking a pie to the face to support our students, the staff at South Haven Public Schools is dedicated and passionate about the children we work with and the South Haven Community!

Has a staff member at SHPS made a difference for your family? Help us spread the love this week by letting us know! Email communications@shps.org or direct message us and we will make sure that staff member hears how their work has impacted you! #RamPride #StayConnected #InThisTogether #DoingMIPart

post_text:
Welcome to Week 2 of the SHPS Continuity of Learning Plan! For your convenience, there are a few different ways to access your child's materials. Visit our website at http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020 for this week's links by grade level. Students and parents will receive an email with the same information and the files will be shared with students on Google Drive.

Students working on iPads should check in their 'Shared with me' folder in Google Slides and click 'present' to access all links and videos.

If you are experiencing Internet connectivity issues and have not contacted the district, please reach out to the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500.

We are here to help and support you through this. Please let us know if you have any questions, concerns, or if you have trouble accessing your instructional material!
#InThisTogether #StayConnected #RamPride #DoingMIPart

shared_text:
South Haven High School Robotics - Team 4855 Ramageddon
May 2 at 11:58 AM ·

It was nice watching the worldwide FIRST Virtual Showcase and seeing all of the dedicated teams, mentors, sponsors and volunteers recognized. In particular, it was an honor to see Team 4855 Ramageddon's name displayed for winning the Chairman's Award at the St. Joseph district event.

Another exciting moment was the announcement of the 2021 game theme: FIRST Game Changers. It's odd to think about next season when we are still sad about missing out on so much with this season, but if you know anything about our team, you know that Ramageddon team members are some of the most resilient people you will ever meet. We are pros at making spectacular comebacks after experiencing setbacks, and COVID-19 has been our biggest setback of all.

So stayed tuned for what's in store for our team as we plan for our comeback. We can't wait to be making waves in our community once again!

post_text:
Today is School Lunch Hero and National Principal Appreciation Day and we couldn't be prouder of the team we have here at SHPS!

During a typical school year, these groups go above and beyond to service our students and this has only increased in light of the COVID-19 pandemic. Since our food delivery offerings started in mid-March, our food service department and volunteers have provided over 82,000 meals to kids in our community! In a matter of weeks, our building leaders were asked to take their plans for the remainder of the school year and rework them into a learning at a distance plan.

Your efforts do not go unnoticed and you make a real difference in the lives of our students, your colleagues, and the entire South Haven Community! #RamPride #InThisTogether #StayConnected #DoingMIPart

post_text:
We are so excited to kick-off our Continuity of Learning Plan today! Instructional material by grade level has been emailed to parents and can be found on our website at: http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020.
Families without Internet connectivity can expect to receive their paper packets delivered to their homes today.

If you are experiencing Internet connectivity issues and have not contacted the district, please reach out to the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500.

We know that this model of learning is different than what we are used to and that each family is unique. We are here to support you and your child through this. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns!

If you are experiencing Internet connectivity issues and have not contacted the district, please reach out to the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500.

We know that this model of learning is different than what we are used to and that each family is unique. We are here to support you and your child through this. Please feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns!

post_text: Hey, Ram Families! Due to our district's participation in the Community Eligibility Program, all of our school families qualify for the Pandemic EBT Program! For more information, take a look at the flyer below.
text: Hey, Ram Families! Due to our district's participation in the Community Eligibility Program, all of our school families qualify for the Pandemic EBT Program! For more information, take a look at the flyer below.

post_text:
We are excited to announce that our Continuity of Learning Plan will officially start on April 27th! We will begin sending instructional material electronically and delivering paper copies to those without Internet on Monday. For now, we have prepared some online information in the same format that families can expect to receive their child's weekly instructional material which was sent to the email addresses on file. This information can also be found on our website, www.shps.org, under Continuity of Learning Plan (http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020) in English and Spanish.

A one-page explanation of the Continuity of Learning Plan will also arrive to school families' homes via mail in the next few days.

While this is new for all of us, and we expect there will be hurdles, we look forward to overcoming them with you, knowing we are all in this together and have the best interest of our kids as our number one priority!
text:

We will begin sending instructional material electronically and delivering paper copies to those without Internet on Monday. For now, we have prepared some online information in the same format that families can expect to receive their child's weekly instructional material which was sent to the email addresses on file. This information can also be found on our website, www.shps.org, under Continuity of Learning Plan (http://www.shps.org/resources/continuity_of_learning_2020) in English and Spanish.

A one-page explanation of the Continuity of Learning Plan will also arrive to school families' homes via mail in the next few days.

While this is new for all of us, and we expect there will be hurdles, we look forward to overcoming them with you, knowing we are all in this together and have the best interest of our kids as our number one priority!

post_text:
Such a fun and unique activity for our kids along with the opportunity to win a gift card to Rocket Arcade and be featured in a full gallery art exhibition at the South Haven Center for the Arts! Download the Color the Town pages from the South Haven Visitors Bureau here: https://www.southhaven.org/uploads/ckeditor/files/South%20Haven%20Coloring%20Sheets(2).pdf?fbclid=IwAR1K-nYjaylzYgUni4cF6PfzELatJ0PCRkU3uAk0z-SRfSqPXfBolfPVMuk and get to coloring! The deadline for submission is May 26th.

Find MORE fun activities by visiting the Michigan Maritime Museum website at http://www.michiganmaritimemuseum.org/learn/education-resources/?fbclid=IwAR2JJq1TH2U55iLqFrbXRDpZJI900YlaR_qqqmQgGyTbZwmL4q2sq_omf7M
shared_text:
Visit South Haven
April 21 at 4:32 PM ·

Here’s a fun thing to do as you “Stay Home - Stay Safe” - The South Haven Visitors Bureau, South Haven Center for the Arts and South Haven Public Schools invite you to “Color the Town” with these pages: https://www.southhaven.org/uploads/ckeditor/files/South%20Haven%20Coloring%20Sheets(2).pdf
of familiar downtown sights. And just to make it a little exciting: 25 $20 gift cards to Rocket Arcade will be awarded randomly to anyone submitting their art! (Deadline for entries is May 26, winners announced June 10. Gift cards will be mailed to winners.) Now, what more could there be you ask?! Your creations will be displayed at the South Haven Center for the Arts in the coming months in full gallery exhibition style! Details and timing to be announced at a later date. Find MORE fun activities: check out these ideas from the Michigan Maritime Museum michiganmaritimemuseum.org/learn/education-resources. Sharpen your colored pencils, get out your crayons - GO! 🎨

post_text:
Isabel has some great advice on processing and expressing feelings on this Thoughtful Thursday! Take a listen to this #EveryKidHealthyWeek video.

Today, we're asking that you show us how you express your feelings by doing something special for someone you love! Don't forget to upload a photo, tag South Haven Public Schools, and use our hashtags: #RamPride #EveryKidHealthyWeek #TakeAction4HealthyKids #DoingMIPart #BronsonWellnessCenter. We will combine all the photos into a photo album for everyone to enjoy!

*Please note, if you do not see your photo in the album, it could be due to privacy settings. Feel free to direct message your photo or email it to communications@shps.org and we will upload it for you!

Bronson Wellness Center
Bronson South Haven Hospital

post_text:
MDHHS has launched a statewide, peer-run warmline for Michiganders living with persistent mental health conditions during the COVID-19 Pandemic.

The warmline will operate seven days a week from 10 a.m. to 2 a.m. at 888-PEER-753 (888-733-7753). It is intended to serve individuals living with persistent mental health challenges including anxiety, depression and trauma.
shared_text:
Michigan Department of Health and Human Services
April 13 at 8:30 PM ·

MDHHS has launched a statewide, peer-run warmline for Michiganders living with persistent mental health conditions during the COVID-19 Pandemic.

The warmline will operate seven days a week from 10 a.m. to 2 a.m. at 888-PEER-753 (888-733-7753). It is intended to serve individuals living with persistent mental health challenges including anxiety, depression and trauma.

Individuals in crisis, including those considering suicide, are urged to contact the Disaster Distress Helpline 24/7 at 800-985-5990 or the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline 24/7 at 800-273-8255.

We will no longer make deliveries on Tuesdays. Each Friday, deliveries will contain a week's worth of breakfasts and lunches. Bus stop locations and delivery times will remain the same. *FOR BUS STOP ADDRESSES, please visit our website at: http://www.shps.org/news/food_deliveries_on_fridays

The original dates for the event this spring have been suspended. We are collaborating internally and communicating with other districts as we brainstorm the best and safest way to move forward. post_text: Congratulations to our district's Technology Coordinator/Network Engineer, Steve Miles, on being selected as the Rotary Club of South Haven's Rotary Hero of the Year! Some of the same qualities the Rotary Club of South Haven, Michigan mentioned below, including his dedication, easy-going demeanor, and expertise in technology, have also made him an immeasurably valuable member of the SHPS Family. His skills have been even more vital as we've navigated the uncertainty of the state-issued suspension of in-person instruction over the past few weeks! Thank you, Steve, for all that you do for SHPS and our community! We are proud to call you a South Haven Ram! #RamPride
shared_text:
Rotary Club of South Haven, Michigan
March 27 at 10:45 AM ·

Congratulations to Steve Miles who is our Club's Hero for 2019-20!

Each Club in our District is invited to nominate a member who has made an extraordinary contribution to the Club over the past year.

The District invited each club to give a two-word descriptive of their nominee. President-elect Dan Thompson chose "Meeting Savior"

Steve has been an active South Haven Rotarian since 2018. In that short time he has faithfully participated in all club activities. His biggest impact on our club have been his ability to make the audio visual equipment at the Wellness Center and other locations work. He comes early to help speakers connect their computers to the Center's equipment. Steve's easy-going demeanor during times of stress is applauded.

Steve's "real job" is coordinating all of the technology for South Haven Public Schools. Can you imagine his challenges during this time of crisis!

We applaud you Steve for your "Service Above Self" for Rotary and our community.

post_text:
We would like to congratulate Zack E. for winning the Gull Lake District Competition Dean's List award earlier this season. Zack was interviewed last weekend online and will be interviewed again this Saturday as he advances towards the MI State Champions Semi-Finalist.
All District Championship Semi-Finalists will be re-interviewed and 15 students will be chosen as the FIRST in Michigan FIRST Robotics Competition Dean’s List Finalists. These students will then be considered to become 1 of the 10 Dean’s List Winners for the 2020 Season.(aka Worlds)

Being recognized as a team’s outstanding student role model is a tremendous achievement and honor. Along with FIRST and FIRST in Michigan, we greatly appreciate the dedication and leadership exemplified by Zack E.! #RamPride
shared_text:
South Haven High School Robotics - Team 4855 Ramageddon
April 2 at 5:47 PM ·

Each year, our mentors have the pleasure of nominating team members for the prestigious Dean's List Award. This year, the mentors nominated Zack E., a sophomore who has been with the team since eighth grade. Zack is our lead welder, an integral member of the build team, one of the voices on our Chairman's video, and our official team liaison. Zack won the Youth Mentor award at the FTC Michigan State Championship for his volunteer work with our middle school team, GOATageddon. Due to the coronavirus outbreak, Zack was unable to go through the Dean's List interview at the Gull Lake competition. Fortunately, FIRST In Michigan has decided to move forward with interviews but they will be via a phone conference instead of being in person. Please join us in wishing Zack good luck as he completes the interview process on Saturday. We're proud of you Zack!

We would like to congratulate Zack E. for winning the Gull Lake District Competition Dean's List award earlier this season. Zack was interviewed last weekend online and will be interviewed again this Saturday as he advances towards the MI State Champions Semi-Finalist.
All District Championship Semi-Finalists will be re-interviewed and 15 students will be chosen as the FIRST in Michigan FIRST Robotics Competition Dean’s List Finalists. These students will then be considered to become 1 of the 10 Dean’s List Winners for the 2020 Season.(aka Worlds)

Being recognized as a team’s outstanding student role model is a tremendous achievement and honor. Along with FIRST and FIRST in Michigan, we greatly appreciate the dedication and leadership exemplified by Zack E.! #RamPride

South Haven High School Robotics - Team 4855 Ramageddon
April 2 at 5:47 PM ·

Each year, our mentors have the pleasure of nominating team members for the prestigious Dean's List Award. This year, the mentors nominated Zack E., a sophomore who has been with the team since eighth grade. Zack is our lead welder, an integral member of the build team, one of the voices on our Chairman's video, and our official team liaison. Zack won the Youth Mentor award at the FTC Michigan State Championship for his volunteer work with our middle school team, GOATageddon. Due to the coronavirus outbreak, Zack was unable to go through the Dean's List interview at the Gull Lake competition. Fortunately, FIRST In Michigan has decided to move forward with interviews but they will be via a phone conference instead of being in person. Please join us in wishing Zack good luck as he completes the interview process on Saturday. We're proud of you Zack!

The article below is helpful in supporting children through times of disappointment and the "Trying Times Toolkit" (link: http://www.shps.org/common/pages/DisplayFile.aspx?itemId=37049548) has some great self-care practices.

*The Trying Times Toolkit is also available in Spanish on our website at www.shps.org > Resources > COVID-19 Updates

post_text:
Looking to secure internet connectivity? ALL SHPS families in Comcast's coverage area are eligible for the Internet Essentials program due to the district's free and reduced lunch status. This means the first TWO months of internet are FREE if you sign up by April 30th and you receive a reduced rate going forward. Check out their coverage map and their frequently asked questions to see if this could benefit your family!
Coverage map: https://broadbandnow.com/XFINITY
FAQ: https://docs.google.com/document/d/14iWZdlBEWFFmIbNn0--GCMRzLxGovADD7xCuDcAiJOU/edit?usp=sharing

Toda esta información está disponible en español en: https://internetessentials.com/. ¡Simplemente cambie el idioma en la parte superior de la página!

post_text:
To better serve our school families, we have collaborated with other school districts and have developed an expanded delivery route for our food deliveries on Tuesdays and Fridays! Curbside pick up is still available from 3:00 - 6:00 PM at the back of the high school on the same days.

*The new S.H.A.E.S Station stop is located on 64th St.

*Port of Call has been removed as Bangor Public Schools will now be servicing these families on Mondays, Wednesdays, & Fridays

*Next week, SHPS will deliver breakfast and lunch as normal on Tuesday, March 31st and again on Friday, April 3rd. In the Friday delivery, families will find enough food to last through Spring Break and until the next delivery.

Spanish Version: http://www.shps.org/common/pages/DisplayFile.aspx?itemId=37032708

post_text: We have set hours for the week of March 23rd through 27th for your convenience! Building administrators will be available in office or by phone on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday from 8:00 - 3:00 PM. They will also be reachable remotely by email every day, Monday through Friday. Central Office will be open Monday through Friday from 8:00 AM until 4:30 PM, (269) 637-0500. Reminder: our technology department can also be reached by email at technology@shps.org. Thank you!

post_text:
Please note that while we truly believe engagement in fun, educational activities during this time away from school is beneficial both academically and mentally for children, all tasks being sent to students by teachers are optional and will not be graded. This comes as legal advice from our district attorney. Make up work may be allowable but specific details should be discussed with your child’s teacher.

If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out to your student’s school office. Thank you!

Spanish version available here: http://www.shps.org/common/pages/DisplayFile.aspx?itemId=37025291

post_text: Starting tomorrow, Friday, March 20th, South Haven Public Schools will be adding a new food delivery stop to best serve our school families! We will now also be offering breakfasts and lunches at the Casco United Methodist Church (corner of 109th & 66th) on Tuesdays and Fridays from 1:30 - 2:00 PM. For our school families that cannot make it to one of the predetermined stops, we invite you to join us anytime between 3:00 PM and 6:00 PM on Tuesdays and Fridays for curbside pick up at SHHS. Please be sure to watch our website, www.shps.org for the latest information on offerings!

post_text:
As we begin the first week of the state-issued school closure, South Haven Public Schools is working to maintain services for our kids. Starting tomorrow, Tuesday, March 17th, we will begin providing a nutritious breakfast and lunch to all of our school families, regardless of free and reduced lunch status, with pick up and delivery options for your convenience!

Please visit the email address you have on file or our website (http://www.shps.org/news/free_breakfast___lunch) for details on delivery stops and pick up dates and times.

If you have any questions, please contact the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500. Take care!

Please visit the email address you have on file or our website (http://www.shps.org/news/free_breakfast___lunch) for details on delivery stops and pick up dates and times.

If you have any questions, please contact the Administration Building at (269) 637-0500. Take care!

post_text:
At this point, many of you are aware that late last night, Governor Whitmer announced a state-wide school closure beginning Monday, March 16th until Monday, April 6th. While this is an unprecedented event presented by the COVID-19 virus, it is a situation we are prepared for with a plan in place.

This plan is in our website, was emailed to parents, and is available in physical copy in your child’s school office.

This is new for everyone and a time where exercising patience, understanding, and collaboration is of utmost importance. Our staff’s top priority has always and will always be your child’s emotional, educational, and physical well-being. We thank you for your patience and flexibility!

http://www.shps.org/news/state-_issued_closure

post_text: The South Haven High School Musical is just around the corner! Don't miss Shrek the Musical this weekend in Listiak Auditorium! With nearly 60 students involved in the cast, crew, and orchestra, you are bound to recognize a face or two. Performances will take place on Friday, March 13th and Saturday, March 14th at 7:00 PM, with an additional show on Sunday, March 15th at 2:00 PM.Tickets are available NOW in the high school office for $5.00 a student/senior citizen and $8.00 general admission. Tickets can also be purchased at the door. We hope to see you this weekend!

post_text: What an exciting accomplishment for our SHHS Robotics Team! Not only did they perform well in their matches this weekend, but they also won the most prestigious award given by FIRST, the Chairman's Award, which honors the team that best represents a model for other teams to emulate! With the award comes automatically qualifying for the state competition! Congratulations to our hardworking Robotics students; we can't wait to see what the rest of the season has in store for you! #RamPride

post_text: Our Superintendent, Mr. Schooley, got into the “March is Reading Month” spirit this past Monday at North Shore Elementary with a school reading of a few favorites, including :"Green Eggs and Ham" and "Alexander, Who Used to Be Rich Last Sunday." Our kiddos are looking forward to a fun-filled month with each school celebrating reading centered activities such as dress up days and mystery readers at the lower levels and the "Tournament of Books" at the upper level. Students will also participate in DEAR (Drop Everything and Read) Time. We hope these fun activities will continue to foster a love of reading in our students!

post_text:
Our very own Mrs. Phillips (iCreate Lab at North Shore Elementary) has been selected as one of this year's Air Zoo Science Innovation Hall of Fame Educator Excellence Award recipients! This award highlights innovative teachers that inspire and foster a love of STEM in their classrooms and comes with a red carpet ceremony, a classroom feature video, and a $750 grant!

Mary is a great asset to SHPS and embodies every component of an excellent and inspiring educator. Please join us in congratulating her on this great honor!

More information on Mary and her award can be found on our website, www.shps.org.

shared_text:
South Haven Band
February 27 at 12:06 PM ·

Join us TONIGHT!

Thursday, February 27, 7:00pm
Listiak Auditorium, FREE

HS Band and Orchestra Winter Concert

For the first time, all 140+ members of the HS Band and Orchestra will combine to create a MEGA Symphony Orchestra and play the entire concert as one ensemble. This will be a sight to see and sounds to remember!

Program (conducted by Mr. Bopp and Mrs. Fiedorowicz)...

Dvorak's New World Symphony, 4th Movement (inspiration for the famous jaws theme)

Warrior Legacy by Soon Hee Newbold

Nimrod: Variation IX from Enigma Variations, Op. 36 by Edward Elgar

Highlights from the movie soundtrack "How To Train Your Dragon" by John Powell

post_text: Lake Michigan College is coming to SHHS this Tuesday, February 25th with two GREAT opportunities! First, they will host a FAFSA night for students and families in the high school from 4:30 - 6:30 PM in Room A101. Following the FAFSA night, they will be raffling off scholarships worth $500 during the home varsity boys basketball game vs. Fennville. Come out on Tuesday, get more information on FAFSA, and win an LMC scholarship! Students interested in the scholarship should contact the Student Success Center!

post_text:
South Haven Public Schools celebrated bus driver appreciation yesterday! Thank you to all of our dedicated drivers who go the extra mile each day to keep our kids safe on their journey to and from school each day. The work you do is meaningful and you are much appreciated by your colleagues, students, and the SHPS community!

Drivers were met in the morning with a delicious breakfast, a number of cards and appreciation signs made by our students, and a few special treats throughout the day
text:
South Haven Public Schools celebrated bus driver appreciation yesterday! Thank you to all of our dedicated drivers who go the extra mile each day to keep our kids safe on their journey to and from school each day. The work you do is meaningful and you are much appreciated by your colleagues, students, and the SHPS community!

Drivers were met in the morning with a delicious breakfast, a number of cards and appreciation signs made by our students, and a few special treats throughout the day

post_text: Join us for a great evening of music at the Middle School Instrumental Winter Concert at 7:00 PM in Listiak Auditorium today! The concert will feature the world premiere of the newly commissioned work, "The Lighthouse Keeps Watch." This piece was commissioned by Mrs. Bopp and the Instrumental Music Boosters and was written specifically for the BMS Concert Band. Cover art for the piece is a photograph by retired BMS Band Director, Sheryl Kaptur. Also featured at this concert will be the BMS String Orchestra performing the 8th grade orchestra's arrangement of an Irish fiddle tune!
shared_text:
South Haven Band
February 18 at 5:20 PM ·

Thanks to all of the students for a night of hard work making music and improving ourselves as musicians and people!

Thanks to Mr. Woodhams, Mr. Bopp, and Mr. Pierson for running sectionals to help our students.

Thanks to Stephanie Timmer and Teresa Ansinn and the Instrumental Music Boosters for feeding our hungry students some delicious pizza!

Thank you to the Instrumental Music Boosters for providing the finances to commission a piece of music for the first time by a South Haven band in a long time!

Thanks again to Martha’s Vineyard for accommodations for our composer and clinician.

A HUGE thank you to Brooke Pierson for writing an emotional and exciting piece, being so gracious to us, and for allowing us to experience this commission project.

And finally, thank you parents for allowing us to share music with your children, hopefully you love the concert this Thursday! 7 PM in Listiak, don’t miss the WORLD PREMIERE of The Lighthouse Keeps Watch!
text:
Join us for a great evening of music at the Middle School Instrumental Winter Concert at 7:00 PM in Listiak Auditorium today! The concert will feature the world premiere of the newly commissioned work, "The Lighthouse Keeps Watch." This piece was commissioned by Mrs. Bopp and the Instrumental Music Boosters and was written specifically for the BMS Concert Band. Cover art for the piece is a photograph by retired BMS Band Director, Sheryl Kaptur. Also featured at this concert will be the BMS String Orchestra performing the 8th grade orchestra's arrangement of an Irish fiddle tune!

South Haven Band
February 18 at 5:20 PM ·

Thanks to all of the students for a night of hard work making music and improving ourselves as musicians and people!

Thanks to Mr. Woodhams, Mr. Bopp, and Mr. Pierson for running sectionals to help our students.

Thanks to Stephanie Timmer and Teresa Ansinn and the Instrumental Music Boosters for feeding our hungry students some delicious pizza!

Thank you to the Instrumental Music Boosters for providing the finances to commission a piece of music for the first time by a South Haven band in a long time!

Thanks again to Martha’s Vineyard for accommodations for our composer and clinician.

A HUGE thank you to Brooke Pierson for writing an emotional and exciting piece, being so gracious to us, and for allowing us to experience this commission project.

And finally, thank you parents for allowing us to share music with your children, hopefully you love the concert this Thursday! 7 PM in Listiak, don’t miss the WORLD PREMIERE of The Lighthouse Keeps Watch!

post_text: A great family night is scheduled for our Lincoln and Maple Grove Elementary families on Thursday, February 20th! Free dinner will be provided along with a presentation by Dr. Henry, Director of the Children's Trauma Assessment Center, hosted at Lincoln Elementary (500 Elkenburg) from 5:15-7:30 PM. Stop by for some wonderful tips parents can use to help their children thrive! Kids will have a blast with staff while taking advantage of fun music, art, and reading activities. We hope to see you there!

post_text: After a great spirit week, Winterfest 2020 is finally here! Join us this afternoon for our Winterfest activities at South Haven High School. With thrilling games from our girls and boys varsity basketball teams, the hall of fame induction, the Purple Pride Pep Band, and the naming of the Winterfest Court, it's sure to be an evening you don't want to miss!

post_text: Looking for plans this evening? Take advantage of this great opportunity to see the South Haven High School Jazz Ensemble perform with the Michigan State University Jazz Octet 1 and 2 in Listiak Auditorium for the Winter Jazz Concert Spectacular 2020! The concert will begin at 7:00 PM and will also feature world renowned jazz pianist, Bruce Barth.

post_text: We are so grateful to our community and organizations like South Haven Project CURB for the countless hours they give and their support of our school district and our students! We can't wait to see the outcome of this project. Your generosity is truly appreciated!
shared_text:
South Haven Project CURB
February 5 at 10:47 AM ·

BREAKING | Project CURB has raised over $10,000 and will begin construction on the sound reduction berm this month!! The berm will be constructed on the east side of SHHS

We are so proud to be a part of this amazing community! A huge a THANK YOU to our project sponsors:

Beachwalk Properties, Apple Insurance of South Haven, Inc. Jensen's Excavating, Visit South Haven, Meijer, Beyer Construction, Walmart, The Timken Company, Hardt Insurance, South Haven Public Schools, Armintrout's Nursery and deBest Inc.

We are beyond excited to see the visual impact of this project!

post_text:
Two weeks ago the administrative staff at South Haven High School was completed with the official start of new Assistant Principal, Tighe Carter! Mr. Carter comes to South Haven with fourteen years of experience in education. We are confident that Mr. Carter will be a great fit for our students, families, and the South Haven Community. Please be sure to welcome him and introduce yourself as you see him out and about in the district!

More information can be found on our website at http://www.shps.org/news/s_h_h_s_welcomes_new_asst__principal

post_text:
Earlier this month, Julie Sheppard 5th Grade Teacher at North Shore Elementary, was nominated for the Hannah E. (Liz) MacGregor Teacher of the Year Award for her outstanding work as the advisor for the district's History Club! This is a national level award and we are so proud of Julie for the nomination, but also for the meaningful impacts she has on our kiddos each day!

More information can be found on our website at http://www.shps.org/news/s_h_teacher_nominated_for_n_h_d_award

post_text:
Although the agenda was light, we had an eventful Board of Education Meeting yesterday! Not only were we able to award two very deserving individuals with Pride Awards (Hadley, a 3rd grader at Lincoln Elementary and Ms. Lana Williams, a special education and English teacher/yearbook advisor), but we were also able to celebrate Board of Education Appreciation Month!

Our students created two special videos, along with beautiful posters, to express their appreciation for the time, energy, and passion our Board puts into making our schools a better place. (Links are in the comments). The first video was created and edited by the Media Production class at the high school and the second was entirely created by the Baseline Middle School Film and Stop Motion Classes!

post_text: Thank you to Marla Bruemmer and Project Pathways for hosting a great Resume' Writing and Critiquing Event at South Haven High School this week! The group invited 30 local professionals to partake in mock interviews and resume' reviews along with additional messages such as professionalism in your interview and how to portray confidence, not cockiness in your interview. 80 students signed up to attend this event and gained experience in the interview world while our community members were able to get to know some of our high school students better!

shared_text:
Baseline Middle School
January 8 at 1:39 PM ·

Thank you to Officer Wildey for helping students in Mr. Dubbink's class understand the justice system and how it impacts each of our lives today. Officer Wildey spoke about Supreme Court cases that shape how Law Enforcement handles situations. Students were particularly interested in amendments about citizens natural rights, including the right to bear arms, search and seizure, rights to an attorney, and due process. Officer Wildey spoke about the importance of Supreme Court cases and the effect they have on all of us and the Constitution's influence over what Law Enforcement both can and cannot do. Students had far more questions for Officer Wildey than time permitted. Several students walked away with an interest in a career in Law Enforcement. Everyone left with a better understanding of the justice system.
A big thank you to Mr. Dubbink for inviting Officer Wildey in and providing this opportunity for his students!
text:

Students were particularly interested in amendments about citizens natural rights, including the right to bear arms, search and seizure, rights to an attorney, and due process. Officer Wildey spoke about the importance of Supreme Court cases and the effect they have on all of us and the Constitution's influence over what Law Enforcement both can and cannot do. Students had far more questions for Officer Wildey than time permitted. Several students walked away with an interest in a career in Law Enforcement. Everyone left with a better understanding of the justice system.
A big thank you to Mr. Dubbink for inviting Officer Wildey in and providing this opportunity for his students!

post_text: South Haven Public Schools' Food Service Department has released a new, interactive and user friendly school nutrition website! This new site includes information about meal components, menus, meal applications, has online payment capabilities, interactive nutrition games, fitness calculators, healthy recipes and more! Also now available is information on CHO count and allergens accessed by simply hovering over menu items! More information can be found at http://www.shps.org/news/new_food_service___nutrition_website or check the site out for yourself at www.shpschildnutrition.org!

post_text: Lincoln and Maple Grove students were visited by Pam Ford from Safe Kids Greater South Haven, led by Bronson. They talked about car safety for tweens - kids ages 8 to 12. Students learned best practices to stay safe in a vehicle and discussed when a booster seat is needed. Thank you for stopping by with this important topic and for measuring each student's height to see if they need a booster seat in the car. Vouchers were provided for a new, free booster seat if students and their families attend the a parent education night, presented on Tuesday, January 21st between 5:00 - 7:00 PM at the Bronson South Haven Wellness Center! Thanks, again, Mrs. Ford and her buddy Skully, for the discussion and activities!

Students learned best practices to stay safe in a vehicle and discussed when a booster seat is needed. Thank you for stopping by with this important topic and for measuring each student's height to see if they need a booster seat in the car. Vouchers were provided for a new, free booster seat if students and their families attend the a parent education night, presented on Tuesday, January 21st between 5:00 - 7:00 PM at the Bronson South Haven Wellness Center! Thanks, again, Mrs. Ford and her buddy Skully, for the discussion and activities!

post_text:
Thank you to our fabulous elementary PTOs for making the holidays extra special for our school families by giving students the opportunity to make and purchase presents for their loved ones!

At North Shore and Maple Grove, students were able to choose from a number of handmade gifts and were assisted in creating and wrapping them for their families. A huge thank you to all of our families and community members that sponsored another child - because of you, every child at Maple Grove and North Shore had the opportunity to create a gift! At Lincoln, every child was able to purchase a gift from the holiday shop, either with money from home or sponsored by the PTO. North Shore also had a shop where purchases could be made with PBIS points!

Thank you, again, to everyone who came together to make this happen this holiday season! Check out the pictures below courtesy of Maple Grove Elementary PTO, Lincoln Rams PTO, SH North Shore Elementary PTO, Lincoln Elementary School, Maple Grove Elementary and SH North Shore Elementary but don't look too close or you may ruin your holiday surprise! :)

post_text:
Take time for school breakfast! Studies show that kids who eat a good breakfast pay better attention in class, retain what they learn, score higher on standardized test and behave better. When your kids join us for breakfast (and lunch) you can rest assured that they are receiving a nutritious meal.

Our school breakfasts meet strict USDA guidelines with less than 10% saturated fat, not more than 500 calories and have no more than 540mg of sodium as a daily average. We do our best to offer items that our students will eat, so while some items might not seem to be healthy—look again!
Our Breakfast Cereals, Biscuits/Pastries, Bagels, Pancakes and French Toast are whole grain, low fat, reduced sodium and reduced sugar.

Help your child start the day off right with school breakfast!

post_text: Fifth grade students in Mr. Bundt's class worked with Mrs. Phillips yesterday to learn a new skill to aid animals being affected by the bushfires in Australia. Students learned to sew tiny koala gloves and bat wraps which will be sent to Australia through a partnership with the Animal Rescue Craft Guild. The koala gloves will be used by animal rescuers to treat burns received in the fires and the wraps will be utilized to care for orphaned bats!
text: Fifth grade students in Mr. Bundt's class worked with Mrs. Phillips yesterday to learn a new skill to aid animals being affected by the bushfires in Australia. Students learned to sew tiny koala gloves and bat wraps which will be sent to Australia through a partnership with the Animal Rescue Craft Guild. The koala gloves will be used by animal rescuers to treat burns received in the fires and the wraps will be utilized to care for orphaned bats!

post_text:
We are pleased to announce that through a partnership with the City of South Haven, a School Resource Officer has been added to the district! Please join us in welcoming Officer Wildey as you see him out and about in our schools!

Some of his duties will include fostering educational programs and activities to increase students' knowledge of and respect for the law and law enforcement agencies, attending some of our extra-curricular activities, providing traffic control as needed, and most importantly, assisting in keeping our students and staff safe at school!

shared_text:
South Haven Athletics
November 12, 2019 at 8:59 PM ·

Members of the girls swim team attended the second shave meet tonight at the Holland Aquatic Center. The medley relay team consisting of Sierra Garber, Elise Postma, Elinor Frost and Kaia Hayes qualified for the D3 MHSAA State Championship Meet with a time of 1:58.71. Congratulations ladies.

post_text:
Due to poor road conditions, we will be rescheduling the Board of Education Awards to Tuesday, November 26th, 2019. Students should arrive to their same designated areas at 6:00 PM. We thank you for your flexibility and hope to see you on November 26th for the Board of Education Awards Ceremony in Listiak Auditorium at 6:30 PM.

Stay safe and have a great rest of your snow day!
